author: T Madhavan
text:
The city police team made a breakthrough in the case where a man was found dead with his head smashed, in Anakaputhur on March 3.

According to police sources, they received a call from a resident that the body of a man was found on the banks of Adyar River near Maghizham Nagar, Anakaputhur.

On receiving information, the Sankar Nagar police rushed to the spot and removed the body and sent it for an autopsy at Government Hospital at Chromepet.

The victim was later identified 30-year-old Eazhumalai, a daily wage worker.

On interrogation, it was found that the victim’s brother-in-law, Pandian, was last seen with him. He was picked by the police for questioning.

Revenge was motive

During interrogation, Pandian confessed to the crime and said that he was very angry that Eazhumalai, behaved violently and frequently abused his sister Anjali and her daughter everyday.

The accused informed the police that he and Eazhumalai went on a drinking spree on the night of March 2.

Once the victim became unconscious, Pandian smashed his head with a big boulder, which killed him instantly. Further investigation is on to find out if there were others involved in the crime, a police official said.

Pandian smashed Eazhumala’s head with a boulder for behaving violently with his sister
title: Man arrested for killing brother-in-law
